text: @Mirandalorian: From the age of 10, I used to read the Harry Potter books to my daughter at bed-time, as they were published ... and later saw the movies with her through her teenage. I've never played a video game in my life ... I'm a film maker and the graphics always seemed so hopelessly crude ... but I was just browsing through YouTube and found this, your first play recording of the new game ... and the graphics seemed much better than I'd seen before, so I thought I'd give it a try out of curiosity. Now I'm hooked watching you play the game and your reactions ... you really do look like the avatar you've selected! When the movie theme began at the end of part one and we saw the Hogwarts Express arriving at the station, you started to tear up and I remembered how my daughter reacted when she saw the first HP movie ... that revived an unexpected nice memory ... thanks. üòä R (Australia)

text:
THIS IS WHAT I WANTED:
1. no major external threat
2. many classes (challenging)
3. goofy side missions (like giving crab and goyle the cupcakes type of stuff)
4. even bigger castle (no big countryside just the forest/hogsmeade and the castle)
5. quidditch (instead of this god awful looking new quidditch game coming up)
6. house cup
7. sneaking at night quests
8. a bigger and scarier forbidden forest
9. detention side quests
10. a personal owl that interacts with you
11. arriving and leaving at kings cross / platform 9 3/4
12. finding the secret passages
13. potion classes
14. O.W.L's
15. Bully/Rival (like Draco)
16. Cozy Christmas/Halloween scenes with lighthearted fun quests
17. Meeting Harrys great grandfather or something
18. 1 Evil teacher with a hidden motive to stop instead of a Goblin antagonist
19. Better dueling club with optional spell classes to be earned
20. Dementors and Expecto Patronum (Dont know how but they could have figured it out)
21. Choosing between christmas at hogwarts or at home/diagon alley?
22. Diagon Alley shopping spree beginning of the year.
23. A tight friend trio (like Harry, Ron, Hermione)
24. Side quests where you have to hide from another Filch type character(squib janitor)
25. Actual consequences to your actions
26. Meeting Voldemorts grandfather at hogwarts(already kind of evil / Maybe a Draco malfoy type)
27. Being able to read the daily prophet a few times
28. Ministry of Magic mission at the beginning of the year to discuss the fact you dont start in The 1st year
29. NO UNFORGIVABLE CURSES (i hated this)
30. Befriend the game keeper (for some fun Care of Magical creatures side quests)

text:
I just got the game on sale last night and I've been hooked on it literally all day. And now that I've put it down for the night, I'm here watching other people play the exact same things! Lmao

My current relationship with Harry Potter is a bit complicated. JK Rowling's recent political hot takes have made it hard for me as a trans person to fully immerse myself in her world like I did when I was a little, as that negative association is always there. It's hard to just ignore the knowledge that the person who created this grand universe also advocates against you and your people. But this game, clearly made with so much love and by true fans, really reinvigorated my wonder. It's truly like experiencing a dream 20 years in the making. Sorting, duels, classes, friends, customization, mystery, some light rule breaking... it's literally all there

Anyway, sorry for the essay. I just really enjoy this game so far and how it can bring to life something that's so personal for so many people. And I think it's a beautiful thing that so many people can come together and bond over their shared love for something like HP. Because ultimately, that passion and community matters more than the feelings of any one person ‚ù§

text: So I'm only just now finishing the game myself and didn't wanna watch someone playthrough until I've finished it completely yes it took me 3 months to 100% the game bc I was also taking my sweet time with it as games should be played imo. And after all that I have to say that I was underwhelmed and a little disappointed with the game in my honest opinion. The story was kind of boring with only a little memorable moments sprinkled in here and there I actually found myself yawning through some of it. The "friends" in the game didn't feel like true friends it felt like they were using us and when they got what they wanted from us they cut us loose and basically just became another mute NPC in the world. Which leads me to my next point the world doesn't feel alive outside of Hogwarts or Hogsmede and even then you just hear the same recycled dialogue and a lot of the NPCs look exactly the same. The hands down best part about the game to me was just the simple exploring and even then I found the world to be pretty empty after I've seen everything which wasn't much honestly. And not to even mention the games lack of the basics of what makes an RPG well... An RPG. You can't even do simple stuff like sit down in places. I wanted to be able to immerse myself completely and when you can't even do something as simple as sit down it kind of ruins it imo. I mean damn you can't even sleep in your bed in the common rooms they could have at least made that an option to give ppl an actual reason to go back to the common rooms. Overall I give this game a 6/10 at most definitely a game I won't return to unless they drop a DLC for it

text:
I am playing the game it two modes.  Mode #1 is to search and seek out everything I can find in both the castle and the rest of the map.  Mode two is playing the missions and side quests.  As such, one of the first things I did after acquiring a broom was to activate every fast travel point in the Floo Network to greatly eliminate wasting time having to travel the map during missions/quests.  

Something GTA5 did somewhat well by allowing rapid travel by having an instant mode in Taxi travel around the map.  Although they still occasionally made you drive from one side of the map to the other just to watch a cutscene and drive back.

text: There's a minor continuity error here, at least I think so. Thestrals weren't domesticated and used to pull the school carriages until Hagrid became assistant groundskeeper in 1942-43 - as Hagrid stated in 'The Prisoner of Azkaban', he believed that he had the only domesticated herd in Britain. Born December 6, 1928, he wouldn't have started Hogwarts until 1940 and would have been 'chucked out' during the 1942 to 1943 school year (his third year).

text: each symbol above the door is a number from 0 to 9. One or two question marks - this is to understand where to put which symbol. The center of a triangle is the sum of all its angles. That is, just put the correct symbol so that the addition of the angles gives the number in the center of the triangle. So if there is 5 (sum) in the center, and at the same time there is a number 2 on one corner, and on the other a horse, which (let's say) occupies the second position above the door (that is, it is 1 ... counting from 0). So we know 1+2+?=5. Obviously, instead of we substitute the horse, which is 2. Nothing complicated,  figure it out

text:
I'd imagine it would have to do with age. Also, I can only speak for the U.S., but there are tests that allow you to bypass grades, highschool, and entry level college courses as long as you have the knowledge to test out of them. Skipping grades requires a valid historic precedence of academic achievement that can be evaluated, written letter from your parents, and a meeting with the school administrators to determine if there is a valid case for you to move ahead, but this is usually for just a single grade. You can also bypass highschool through the General Educational Development Test or GED which is a high school equivalency credential and jump into college if you are older or were away from school for what would have been your final year or don't want to return to high school for another reason. DSST or CLEP tests allow you to test out of and recieve credits for introductory level college courses which might otherwise have you two semesters worth of classes. Then there is the famous dozen or so preteen genuises who graduated highschool before they were, well, teenagers. The youngest world record currently is Michael Kearney who completed secondary education at age 6. So as far as real world precedents, they are there.

In terms of extra content, don't worry, they can include the Tri-Wizard Tournament, Quidditch events, post 5th year summer activities, 6th year, and 7th year at 'minimum'. Without diluting content quality there is easily 2-3 years worth of stuff they could do. 1-7 might sound nice but practically speaking is impossible. The movies, which are far faster to produce than video games still took 10 years to complete that 7 year journey for Harry Potter mind you.

text:
been discussing and nitpicking the production of this game over at a programmers forum, and based on what I see and what I personally know about the tech involved, I honestly don't know what the fuck the haters are talking about.
the game looks SOLID... obviously it's gonna have some bugs, but compare this to the monster that was 2077, and this laps that three times over... EVERYTHING is detailed, EVERYTHING is alive... I'm not a fan of the saga, so I wouldn't know how to judge it in terms of lore, but the gameplay is showing up solid as a rock.... and that's the point! it's a game for the fans of the saga! if you're a fan of the saga, you look at this and you have to be tripping balls right now.
I've watched gameplays from fans and non-fans, and one of the fans was all excited about being able to lounge inside a wine barrel, in something that looks like a Hobbit hovel from LOTR, right next to plants that he figures he'd be able to roll up and smoke some time later.... THAT was his excitement, of all things.
everyone kept commenting the same thing: "This looks amazing! If you're a Potterhead, you have to be trippin' right now!"

text: I stayed up until midnight and played it right up to the sorting then I had to go to bed because work. Sigh. But I knew this video was waiting for me to watch so I can distract myself at work and enjoy seeing your reactions. We choose the same face for our character! But I went with a pinkish hair color. I'm a ravenclaw so I enjoyed seeing a different common room with you! Hugflepuff will be my second playthrough. I am really enjoying it so far, that opening was epic, and I can't wait to get off work to play some more! Gonna restart though as apparently there were several hidden chests I missed. I have a few minor complaints, mostly reactionary complaints so far though. I mean our character was attacked by dragon, watched a man get killed, and then just seems... fine. Like really? No worries, off to the sorting! Even Fig seemed to get over George pretty quick. Anywho, not a big deal but it annoyed me a bit lol. Cant wait to keep following your journey through the game.

text: @Mirandalorian: From the age of 10, I used to read the Harry Potter books to my daughter at bed-time, as they were published ... and later saw the movies with her through her teenage. I've never played a video game in my life ... I'm a film maker and the graphics always seemed so hopelessly crude ... but I was just browsing through YouTube and found this, your first play recording of the new game ... and the graphics seemed much better than I'd seen before, so I thought I'd give it a try out of curiosity. Now I'm hooked watching you play the game and your reactions ... you really do look like the avatar you've selected! When the movie theme began at the end of part one and we saw the Hogwarts Express arriving at the station, you started to tear up and I remembered how my daughter reacted when she saw the first HP movie ... that revived an unexpected nice memory ... thanks. üòä R (Australia)
